title: Part Time Graphic Communication Designer
description_html:
WHY YOU WILL LOVE US

We’re a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. We come from all over the world, but we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”. How we realize this vision is based on our shared humanistic values. These values guide our work and build our inclusive, open and honest culture. It’s all based on a spirit of togetherness and enthusiasm. We work hard, but we have fun doing it. We’re always looking for people who share our positive attitude and values.


WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU

  • You are able to use commercial and visual competence through a keen eye for aesthetics to capitalise on short and long term business opportunities.
  • You have a passion for about home furnishing, design and how people live at home
  • You are able to explain concepts verbally and visual interpretation
  • You are able to prioritize and organize your work to make the most efficient use of available time and meet agreed deadlines
  • You are able to work in a fast retail environment
  • You are enthusiastic with working in a team
  • You have good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese
  • You have proficient computer skills and experience of using graphic design software (eg. Adobe Creative Suite) and production tools (eg printers, pre-press production and print techniques)
  • You are a degree or diploma holders in graphic communication design, media and typography or other related discipline
  • You are experienced in working with graphic design in an advertising agency or retail design studio


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY

  • Use graphic communication competence to strengthen the uniqueness and consistency of the IKEA identity in store communication by applying the principles of IKEA visual and verbal identity
  • Actively contribute to the department action plan with initiatives that will grow the business, support long-term profitability and execute the agreed plans in close co-operation with other functions
  • Plan, implement and evaluate store communication to ensure that it conveys the benefits of the IKEA Concept as well as completes and enhances range presentation
  • Actively contribute to the development, implementation and evaluation of the store communication strategies that support a convenient shopping experience
  • Act quickly to exploit commercial opportunities and understand the impact of the actions on the financial results
  • Secure visual balance and consistency, quality and simplicity, cost-efficiency and sustainability in producing and implementing store communication
  • Stay up to date with knowledge about home furnishing, communication and retail design trends to follow creative directions that inspire and surprise store visitors
  • Working Hour: Mon-Fri: 9:00am-5:45pm; Alternate Sat: 9:00am-1:00pm (on shift)


TOGETHER AS A TEAM

To inspire and surprise visitors by presenting and communicating the IKEA home furnishing offer with strong visual impressions that exceed visitors’ expectations.


STAFF BENEFITS

Monthly Store Sales Incentive, Annual Fixed Bonus, 17 days Public Holiday, Paid Leave (e.g. 12 to 18 days Annual Leave, 14 weeks Maternity Leave, 5 days Paternity Leave, 1 week Marriage Leave), Employee Medical Coverage, Non-Contributory Retirement Plan, Staff Purchase Discount, Birthday Coupon, Referral Bonus, Excellent Career Path


For more details, please WhatsApp 93751657


Personal data collected will be kept and handled confidentially by authorized personnel for recruitment purposes only. It might also be disclosed to our subsidiaries, associates and agencies authorized to process the information for appointment. The Company will retain the applications of candidates not selected for a maximum period of 24 months after the selection process is finalized. Our Personal Information Collection Statement (PICS) is available at our career site and can be provided upon request by contacting our Human Resources Department. Applicants not heard from us within six weeks may consider their applications filed for future reference.

title: Business Architect
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in business architect? 

The challenge is to: 

  • Define, model, rationalize, and maintain business architecture within the enterprise architecture repository, aligning with both current and future needs in omni-channel retail operations.
  • Lead architectural design, implement, and continually optimize Core and Extended Retail ERP solutions, with a focus on integration efficiency, controlled customizations, and scalability for future growth.
  • Partner with manager to develop business architecture artifacts to inform investment decisions, technology roadmaps, and portfolio planning.
  • Design and validate integration architectures between Oracle Retail and related systems (e.g., WMS, POS, eCommerce) to streamline data flows and improve system performance.
  • Contribute to and review the Architecture & Integration Blueprint, endorsing business architecture and data design for retail operations.
  • Analyze and produce architecture models and viewpoints across business, information system, and technology domains to address evolving business requirements.
  • Partner with solution architects, data architects and business analysts to ensure end-to-end capability and information flows for integrated, data-driven retail environments.
  • Participate in enterprise architecture development and governance processes, while providing architectural guidance and promoting best practices to project implementation teams.
  • Maintain a culture of continuous improvement, using architectural thinking to drive operational excellence, transformation, and innovation.


Do you have experience in business architect? 

  • Bachelors' Degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent.
  • Minimum of 6 years of experience in business analyst, product owner, IT related fields and domains, ideally in the retail or consumer sectors.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in business capability and process modeling.
  • Experience in developing enterprise architecture or solutions for retail business.
  • Experience in conducting enterprise-level assessments, developing technology roadmaps, and driving programs with measurable outcomes.
  • Certified in TOGAF or equivalent is preferred.
  • Proficient in major cloud technologies and services (AWS, Azure, GCP) is preferred.
  • Proficient in integration technologies is preferred.
  • Sound understanding of cybersecurity, cloud and microservices architectures is preferred.
  • Effective communication skills, and to be able to present technical concepts concisely.
  • Able to work independently and thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

title: Senior Category Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management?

  • Develop and implement merchandise, buying, and pricing strategies for assigned categories to boost penetration, drive sales and margin growth, strengthen competitive positioning, and seize market opportunities. 
  • Execute and assess merchandising initiatives and category plans aligned with customer interests and preferences. 
  • Maintain optimal stock levels through effective promotion planning and inventory management. 
  • Source products locally and internationally with a strong understanding of market trends and consumer demand. 
  • Preparing and communicating the promotion schedules to the Commercial team and internal stakeholders.
  • Utilize analytics tools to provide a timely review of all promotional effectiveness, provide recommendations and action plans for improvement.
  • Establish and nurture long-term strategic partnerships with vendors to support sustainable business growth. Connect to new suppliers for new partnership opportunities, shape decisions about products, pricing, and promotional strategies. 


Do you have experience in Buying and Merchandising?

  • University graduate or tertiary education  
  • 5-7 years retail merchandising experience  
  • Analytical, creative, customer-focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated 
  • Strong negotiation, project management and relationship-building skills 
  • Good communication skills and good command of English and Chinese
  • Knowledge of category management

title: Key Account Executive, Insurance
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in partnership? 

The challenge is to: 

Marketing & CRM coordination:

  • Strategic planning of joint marketing and engagement plans with the partner to deliver towards the agreed roadmap
  • Facilitate the execution of marketing and CRM initiatives with agency interface

Business Support:

  • Develop engagement plans and coordinating activities between yuu Rewards and our insurance partners
  • Work closely with internal teams to design and improve customer journey 
  • Manage across insurance partners and support to achieve financial performance

Partner management:

  • Help manage relationships at all levels within partner organisations 
  • Manage ongoing governance and drive strategic discussion and alignment with insurance partners

  

Do you have experience in insurance?

  • University degree
  • 2+ years’ experience in insurance / financial services industry, with exposure to general and life insurance preferred
  • Loyalty and client management / partnerships experience preferred but not essential
  • Strong commercial, communication and interpersonal skills
  • A strong team player, proactive, self-motivated and well organized
  • Good PowerPoint, Excel and Word skills
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese
  • Banking background will also be considered

title: Assistant Category Manager
description_html:
Is that your next challenge in category management?

The Job:

 

  • Product Launches: Lead new product launches in Hong Kong, including registering and renewing product registrations with the Department of Health for both Hong Kong and Macau.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all products and offers comply with the Trade Description Ordinance and relevant FEHD regulations.
  • Merchandise Strategy: Develop and implement merchandise strategies for healthcare products, ensuring alignment with sales, profit, and income generation targets.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with retail and sales management to optimize store layouts, promotions, and display techniques for maximizing sales and profits.
  • Regulatory Affairs: Partner with the Regulatory Affairs team to ensure all products meet regulatory standards for the Hong Kong market.
  • Planogram Management: Conduct planogram reviews for optimal product placement to enhance visibility and sales.
  • Range Optimization: Continuously identify range optimization opportunities to maximize productivity through identifying product innovation launch opportunities and conducting range reviews.
  • Trade Marketing Support: Assist in supporting trade marketing initiatives to drive product visibility and customer engagement.
  • Ad Hoc Assignments: Perform any additional tasks as needed to contribute to the team's success.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • University graduate, degree holder in Nutrition Science or related disciplines is highly preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of FMCG experience with at least 2 years at management level
  • Passionate, energetic, flexible and action-oriented
  • Good planning, analytical and influencing skills
  • An acute market sense strong negotiation and communication skills

title: Senior Marketing Executive
description_html:
Is that your next challenge in marketing team?

· Campaign Development: Executing above-the-line marketing campaigns and organizing brand events.

· Trade Marketing Collaboration: Partnering with trade marketing for below-the-line execution.

· Post-Launch Reporting: Analyzing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and promotions.

· Packaging Assistance: Contributing to product packaging development.

· Social Media Management: Planning and managing communications on Facebook and Instagram.

· Digital Marketing Support: Overseeing SEM/SEO strategies and website management.

· Collaboration for Promotions: Working with cross-functional teams for YUU promotions.

· Vendor Management: Assisting with purchase orders, invoicing, and vendor creation.

· Governance: Championing brand privacy and IT security practices.



Qualifications & Experience:

· Bachelor’s degree in Marketing/ Business Administration or related disciplines

· Minimum 1-2 years of marketing experience with hands-on trade promotion and advertising experience

· Self- motivated with excellent communication and interpersonal skills

· Creative, adaptable, high learning agility

· Well-organized, enjoy working in fast paced organization

· Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese

· Experienced in FMCG or retail industry is an absolute advantage

title: Digital & eCommerce Marketing Assistant Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Digital and E-commerce?

The challenge is to:

  • Performance Marketing Strategy: Develop and implement performance marketing strategies to enhance brand visibility and e-commerce revenue growth. 
  • Campaign Management: Oversee and optimize digital marketing campaigns, including paid search, display, social media, and affiliate marketing, to maximize ROI.
  • Data Analysis: Analyze campaign performance data and generate reports to assess the effectiveness of marketing efforts; use insights to drive continuous improvement.
  • Budget Management: Manage the performance marketing budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources for maximum impact.
  • SEO/SEM Optimization: Manage and implement SEO strategies to improve organic search rankings and drive qualified traffic through SEM initiatives.
  • Collaborative Work: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and achieve marketing goals.
  • Trends and Competitor Analysis: Stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for enhancing our performance marketing efforts.

 

Do you have experience in Marketing?

  • Bachelor’s degree or above in Marketing, Business Administration, E-commerce, or a related discipline.
  • Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in performance marketing, online marketing, or within a digital agency, preferably in e-commerce.
  • Proven track record in developing and executing successful performance marketing strategies, preferably in the e-commerce sector.
  • Proficient in Google Ads, Meta (Facebook/Instagram), and other major digital marketing platforms; experience with programmatic advertising is a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data, generate actionable insights, and make data-driven decisions.
  • Advanced knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, GA4, Data Studio); experience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimization is preferred.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
  • Demonstrated project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple campaigns and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Creative thinker with a strategic, results-oriented mindset.
  • Experience in budget planning and resource allocation for digital marketing campaigns.
  • Immediate availability is highly preferred.

  • You are business-minded and result-driven with a strong customer focus.

  • You have experience working in a customer-oriented business.
  • You have experience actively selling by understanding customers and their needs.
  • You have an interest in people’s everyday lives at home and home furnishing.
  • You are open to change and highly flexible.
  • You have the ability to work together in a team.
  • You have the ability to engage others by creating passion for your plans.
  • You have the ability to make quick decisions and take personal initiatives.
  • You have the ability to communicate effectively in English.
  • You have the ability to prioritize and organize your own work to make efficient use of the time available.
  • You have a clear and proven ability to meet and exceed customers’ demands, thereby increasing sales.
  • You have values that reflect the IKEA values.

 

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY

  • Ensure you have the right number of competent co-workers in the right place at the right time, and secure that they are fully able and available to serve customers and actively help them to buy.
  • Ensure the shop is in excellent shape, fully and efficiently stocked with the four merchandising basics in place at all times, and that the IKEA product range is presented in ways that inspire and satisfy customers.
  • Ensure your team has all the correct knowledge about the product range in your department and the IKEA services so that they can share this with IKEA customers to improve their overall shopping experience.
  • Understand the different IKEA sales and communication channels and IKEA know-how in order to make the best commercial use of this information for different customers.
  • Take responsibility for your department goals and secure that your action plan ensures the country priorities for your Home Furnishing Business (HFB) are implemented in your store. Follow up and take action accordingly by using proven solutions and good examples.
  • Actively sales steer to your department’s top-selling products, prioritized products (e.g., overstock/övertag), and IKEA service products in order to maximize sales and long-term profitability.
  • Act quickly on commercial opportunities, changing availability of products (overstock and out of stock), and customer feedback (10 most asked questions).
  • Keep an active eye on the competition and take appropriate action when necessary, communicating this to your matrix partner in the Service Office.
  • Develop your team and its individual members, ensuring you have a succession plan in place.
  • Actively promote the IKEA social and environmental commitment and work with your team to understand how, together, you can contribute to sustainability.

 

TOGETHER AS A TEAM

To inspire and surprise visitors by presenting and communicating the IKEA home furnishing offer with strong visual impressions that exceed visitors’ expectations. This will strengthen the IKEA Brand and convert more visitors into customers. 

 

STAFF BENEFITS

Monthly Store Sales Incentive, Annual Fixed Bonus, 17 days Public Holiday, Paid Leave (Paid Annual Leave, 14 weeks Maternity Leave, 5 days Paternity Leave, 1 week Marriage Leave), Employee Medical Coverage, Non-Contributory Retirement Plan, Staff Purchase Discount, Birthday Coupon, Referral Bonus, Excellent Career Path

 

Personal data collected will be kept and handled confidentially by authorized personnel for recruitment purposes only. It might also be disclosed to our subsidiaries, associates and agencies authorized to process the information for appointment. The Company will retain the applications of candidates not selected for a maximum period of 24 months after the selection process is finalized. Our Personal Information Collection Statement (PICS) is available at our career site and can be provided upon request by contacting our Human Resources Department. Applicants not heard from us within six weeks may consider their applications filled for future reference.

We’re a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. We come from all over the world, but we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”. How we realize this vision is based on our shared humanistic values. These values guide our work and build our inclusive, open and honest culture. It’s all based on a spirit of togetherness and enthusiasm. We work hard, but we have fun doing it. We’re always looking for people who share our positive attitude and values.

title: Category Executive (RTE)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management?

  • Assist Category Manager to manage the assigned product category 

  • Arrange logistic, stock allocation and return of purchased products 

  • Coordinate with vendors to implement promotion plan and promotional display for stores 

  • Maintain business transaction records and product inventories control 

  • Support the team to prepare categories sales analysis and system data maintenance 

  • Build a good relationship with internal teams to facilitate smooth operations  

  • Provide routine administrative support, e.g. new vendor/new item creation, follow up of item launching and promotion plan, etc. 

 

Do you have experience in Buying and Merchandising?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business related disciplines 

  • Minimum 1-2 years of relevant experience in buying 

  • Passionate about retail, food products and sales-driven 

  • Team player with good interpersonal skills 

  • High accuracy in data input 

  • Proficient in MS Office and Chinese Word Processing  

  • Good command of both spoken and written English & Chinese 

  • Immediate availability is preferred

title: Learning & Development Part-time Trainer
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Learning & Development?

The challenge is to:

  • Attend TTT offered by Vendor.
  • Customize training content based on audience needs (e.g., for managers vs. frontline staff) and incorporate real-world scenarios.
  • Deliver interactive training sessions 
  • Assess participant understanding through quizzes, demonstrations, and feedback mechanisms, adjusting delivery as needed.
  • Collaborate with the Project Lead to update training materials and incorporate system updates or FAQs.
  • Provide post-training support, such as follow-up sessions or Q&A resources, to reinforce learning.
  • Collect and report on training outcomes, including participant evaluations and suggestions for improvements.


Do you have experience in Learning & Development?

  • Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, or a related field
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in Learning & Development to prepare training materials and support training delivery
  • Familiarity with HR systems and digital learning platforms (e.g., Time & Attendance, ServiceNow, Digital Rostering, SAP SuccessFactors).
  • Understanding of system training for operational tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Digital Rostering) is highly desirable.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to deliver engaging training sessions and manage diverse audiences. Proficiency in Cantonese would be an advantage.

title: IKEA宜家家居 沙田分店及大埔規劃及訂購中心招聘日 (2月6日)
description_html:
你將會愛上宜家家居 

我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。 

  

招聘日詳情 

**歡迎學生/畢業生/家庭主婦/中高齡人士參加招聘日; 為確保安排順暢，本次招聘日需提前預約面試** 


現正招募多個職位【全職/兼職 – 銷售、顧客服務、餐飲】

IKEA宜家家居 沙田分店及大埔規劃及訂購中心招聘日 (2月6日)

日期：2026年2月6日 (星期五)

時間：下午2時30分至下午6時30分

面試地點：沙田新城市中央廣場第 1 座 5 樓（IKEA 寫字樓)

預約面試：https://ikeashatin.youcanbook.me

*沙田分店*
推薦給善於與顧客溝通的你
銷售助理 (全職/兼職)

推薦給對餐飲有熱誠的你
廚師 (全職) (月薪$16,500起)
餐廳/美食站助理 (兼職)

*大埔規劃及訂購中心*
推薦給善於與顧客溝通的你
銷售助理 (兼職)

全職員工福利  

年終雙糧、每月6至7天休息日、17天公眾假期、有薪假期 (如：12-18天年假、14星期產假、5天侍產假、1星期婚假)、員工醫療保險、免供款退休計劃、集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金、良好晉升機會等 


兼職員工福利 

集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金 

  

如未能出席上述招聘日，申請者亦可WhatsApp 93751657 遞交職位申請。 

 

申請者提供之資料絕對保密，申請人之資料只供DFI零售集團附屬機構或授權之代理人作招聘及甄選用途。招聘過程完畢後，申請資料將被保留二十四個月作參考之用。本公司已備有一份「私隱政策聲明」，閣下如有需要可瀏覽公司網頁或以書面形式向人力資源部索取有關資料。申請人如在遞交申請表後六星期內仍未接獲通知約見，其有關申請將被存檔，以作日後同類型職位空缺考慮之用。

title: Internal Audit Officer
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in internal audit? 

The challenge is to: 

  • Establish and maintain close partnerships with Store Support Center functions (“SSC”) for Health & Beauty formats.
  • Ensure audits are conducted in adherence to globally accepted Internal Audit standards promulgated by the IIA. 
  • Appropriate planning and risk assessments are conducted, identifies controls in place to mitigate identified risks and opportunities for improvements.
  • Performs audit reviews to verify that controls are operating through testing and interviewing techniques and documents the results of audit reviews in accordance with Group Internal Audit standards.
  • Identify internal control deficiencies and opportunities to improve business effectiveness and efficiency, and to document the results in accordance with the DFI Group Audit Manual.
  • Assist in monitoring and reviewing the close out of prior audit findings by management, and to timely report on overdue items to senior management for remediations.  
  • Assist in performing any ad hoc reviews, advisories and investigations as assigned, and provide practical and effective recommendations to management in enhancing the control environment within the Company.
  • Responsible for stakeholder’s engagement to ensure smooth execution of audits.
  • Any other ad-hoc assignments as assigned by the Format Lead.


Do you have experience in internal audit? 

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in internal/external audit
  • Degree or Diploma in Accounting/Finance/Marketing or equivalent
  • Have fundamental knowledge in principles of governance, risks and controls
  • Proficient in MS Office 
  • Possess high energy level and strong work ethic with a commitment to continuous improvement in a dynamic and changing environment that strive to exceed expectations
  • Good communication, analytical and presentation skills (written and verbal)
  • Ability to work independently and operate as a team
  • Prior experience working in retail, operations/ supply chain or a matrix organization is a plus
  • Willing and able to travel within and outside home country (20%)

title: Area Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Retail Operations?

  • Managing assigned store group in accordance with company policies and procedures for achieving sales, gross profits, expenses budgets, key store performance indicators and ensuring compliance to legislations.
  • Coach company store-in-charges and franchisees for identifying sales opportunity, managing customer services and operations standards proactively
  • Identify and develop high potentials staff to build future talent pool for the company
  • Manage franchisees and advise their activities in accordance with franchisee agreement, company policies and procedures to achieve long term sustainability of franchisee relationship
  • Learn and communicate new programmes, policies and procedures to assigned store group effectively to ensure proper execution in accordance with company requirements
  • Provide market intelligence and store feedback to management timely

 

Do you have experience in retail industry?

  • Reporting to Operations Manager
  • Form 5 or above
  • Minimum 5 years supervisory experience in managing multiple stores in retail or catering industry
  • Solid store operations knowledge and time management
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and decision making skills
  • A good coach and team player who can communicate and influence others effectively
  • Self-motivated, enthusiastic and drive for continuous improvement
  • Candidates with less experience will be considered as Area Manager In Training

title: Category Manager (RTE)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in category management?

  • To implement the merchandise, buying and pricing strategies for designated categories to increase category penetration, drive sales and margin, enhance competitive edges and capitalize market opportunities.
  • To execute and evaluate merchandising activities and category plans of customers' interests
  • To build and manage relationships with vendors for long term strategic partnership
  • To ensure healthy stock level by good promotion plan and stock management 
  • To source locally or overseas with good understanding of market trend

 

Do you have experience in merchandising?


  • University graduate or tertiary education
  • Minimum 4 years retail merchandising experience
  • Good influencing and negotiation skill
  • Analytical, creative, customer focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated
  • Good interpersonal and people management skill
  • Good communication skill and good command of English and Chinese
  • Knowledge of category management

title: Category Manager (Healthy Food)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in category management? 

The challenge is to: 

  • To liaise with Marketing Department about developing attractive and interesting promotional events which follow pre-agreed selling plan.
  • To work closely with retail and sales management to ensure that store layouts, promotions and display techniques are effective in maximizing sales and profit from the specific merchandise categories.
  • To establish and maintain effective margin and price controls which maximize business profits whilst delivering a good value offer to the customer.
  • To negotiate and work with vendors to build mutually beneficial relationships to ensure long term strategic partnership, leading to lower costs and higher margin.
  • To manage stock levels and mark-downs to ensure that product availability is high
  • To develop and train subordinates ensuring that they are customer and product focused.

 

Do you have experience in healthy food? 

  • University graduate
  • At least 7 years solid category management, trade marketing, or account servicing experience in FMCG industry
  • Strong influencing, negotiation and communication skills
  • Good analytical skill, well-planned and acute market sense
  • Proficiency in English and Chinese
  • With category management experience of healthy food, or health is preferred

title: Member Experience Design Assistant Manager, yuu Rewards
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in member experience design? 

The challenge is to: 

  • Conduct yuu Member research: Gather actionable insights through member research to understand member needs, pain points, and behaviors, which inform design decisions, both in Hong Kong and Greater Bay Area.
  • Create a single view of member voice: Consolidate various sources of member feedback and data, including but not limited to qualitative research, qualitative research, internal data insight analysis, social listening analysis, customer experience measurements, customer service complaint/ queries, etc. to truly represent yuu members’ voice with evidence. 
  • Develop program experience design strategies: Create comprehensive design strategies considering member’s end-to-end lifecycle, starting from enrolment, earning through different means and with different partners, redeeming in yuu app, and points expiry to ensure the experience designed is addressing specific business goals with clear intention to drive brand and member engagement. 
  • Facilitate ideation and alignment sessions: Lead and support brainstorming and ideation sessions to generate innovative solutions to revitalise the program, collaborating with cross-functional teams within yuu and outside of yuu within DFI Group. 
  • Prototype and Test new concepts: Create prototypes to test new concepts, gather feedback, and iterate on designs for continuous improvement and ensuring that solutions are effective and member centred.
  • Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with yuu Commercial, Product, Insight, Operation teams, and other DFI stakeholders to ensure alignment and effective communication throughout the design process. 
  • Measure Success: Track and analyze key metrics to assess the impact of new initiatives on business and member outcomes, making data-driven decisions. 
  • Promote Design Thinking: Champion design thinking methodologies across teams to foster a culture of innovation and human-centered design. 

 

  

Do you have experience in member experience design? 

  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Design, Business/ Innovation Strategy, Industrial / Product / Interactive Design, or a related field. 
  • 5+ years of working experience as a Design Strategist or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of design thinking principles and strategic problem-solving. Prior experience in retail, loyalty program and/ or GBA market is a plus.
  • Technical Proficiency: Proficient in design software and tools, such as Adobe Creative Suite, and experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research. Experience in using design and research GenAI tools e.g. Copilot, Deepseek, Perplexity, Midjourney, Nano banana, Perplexity is a must.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate design concepts and strategies effectively. 
  • Team Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams, facilitating cooperation and alignment towards common goals. 
  • Excellent English, Cantonese and Mandarin oral and written communication skills

title: Operations Support Executive
description_html:
The Operations Support Executive provides comprehensive administrative and operational support to ensure smooth execution of retail and promotional activities. This role involves managing documentation, coordinating stock allocations, supporting financial processes, and ensuring compliance with operational standards. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and effective communication are essential.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Administrative & Documentation Support

  • Process administrative tasks related to sales and operations.
  • Prepare and ensure stock allocations are completed before deadlines.
  • Arrange, coordinate, and distribute stock allocation to relevant stakeholders.
  • Raise invoices and ensure timely submission for payment processing.
  • Collate monthly files and maintain GSM tactical and P-cycle records.
  • Manage and submit application requests to external vendors and follow up to completion.
  • Compile Ops meeting agendas and handle ad-hoc administrative duties.

 

2. Finance & Billing Support

  • Assist with billing submissions and payment follow-ups.
  • Process overcharge and refund requests.

 

3. Coordination & Communication

  • Coordinate with stores to obtain required information and responses.
  • Communicate atrium and site activation details to store teams and vendors.
  • Serve as a point of contact for administrative queries from vendors and internal teams.
  • Support coordination with store teams on GRN and stock movements.
  • Ensure clear communication and proper documentation of issue resolution.

 

4. Stock & Voucher Management

  • Track and manage OP vouchers.
  • Distribute and record Rx pads, drowsy labels, lanyards, card cases, generic TM cards, and markdown stickers.
  • Coordinate issuance of orange badges.

 

5. Compliance & Data Accuracy

  • Verify supporting documents and data accuracy before submission.
  • Track discrepancies and follow through until resolution.
  • Maintain organized records for audits and internal reference.

title: People & Culture Business Partner Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in People Business Partnering?

The challenge is to:

  • Serve as a trusted business partner, aligning our people strategy with the overall business strategy, proactively addressing any people-related matters, and ensuring fair treatment of team members in accordance with our Values.
  • Partner with Functional Leaders on organizational design, talent pipelines, and succession planning.
  • Design and implement initiatives that enhance team motivation and recognition, drive productivity and engagement while embodying our Caring Passionately value in every interaction.
  • Collaborate with other People & Culture teams to establish effective processes and practices for talent acquisition, development, rewards, engagement, and retention.
  • Deliver core People & Culture processes and routines right first time to support operational excellence and employee experience.
  • Drive the annual performance and salary review process and support individual performance improvement cases.
  • Ensure all people related issues are being addressed in compliance with internal policies and legally compliant with HK law.
  • Provide support for ad hoc projects and perform additional duties as required.

 

Do you have experience in People Business Partnering?

  • Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or a related field.
  • Minimum of 10 years of solid business partnering experience from multinational company. 
  • Less experienced candidate will be considered to be Assistant Manager.
  • Background in FMCG, retail & matrix environment preferred.
  • Understanding of the HK Employment Ordinance and proficiency in HR best practices.
  • Demonstrated expertise in problem-solving, influencing, and stakeholder management.
  • Exceptional articulation, independence, agility, flexibility, and adaptability – adept at understanding the dynamics of individuals, balancing HR perspectives with business needs.
  • Strong sense of responsibility with excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint & AI tools for effective data analysis and presentation.
  • Knowledge in using SAP SuccessFactors is highly preferred.

title: Construction Executive
description_html:
ROLE PURPOSE

The Construction Executive provides comprehensive administrative, coordination, and compliance support for construction projects. The role ensures smooth project execution through effective documentation management, project coordination, office administration, ESG compliance, and adherence to safety and regulatory standards. This position acts as a central point of contact for project stakeholders, facilitating timely communication and accurate reporting, while supporting the project team in achieving operational efficiency and regulatory compliance.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES

  1. Documentation & Record Management:

 

  • Manage the flow of all project documentation; including purchase orders, invoices, VOs, quotations, tender docs, FFA & capex compilation, FA write off/transfer form, circulation capex & cost summary for docusign.
  • Distribute project documents to subcontractors in a timely manner.
  • Maintain and organize both digital and hard copy filing systems for all projects, ensuring they are always audit-ready.
  • Prepare and process routine correspondence, meeting agendas, and minutes.
  • Execute day-to-day tasks for timely and efficient issuance of PO (purchase order) requests using GEP system
  • Manage monthly and yearly accrual
  • Provide support for application and termination of utilities account and authority accounts (TOL and BCA)
  • Independently cross-check data entry through daily and periodic checks

 

  1. Project Coordination & Support:

 

  • Track and log the status of purchase orders, invoices, VOs, quotations, tender docs, FFA&capex compilation, FA write off/transfer form and docusign sign off; providing regular updates to the Project Manager.
  • Assist the project team with the preparation of reports, including daily reports, safety reports, and progress updates.
  • Coordinate project meetings, including scheduling, preparing agendas, and distributing minutes.
  • Assist with the close-out process by collecting and organizing warranties, as-built drawings, and O&M manuals.
  • Maintain a proper and accurate digital filing system for reference and audits
  • Manage the department's procurement processes, including GEP (reno/electricity, if required) approval by Manager

 

  1. Office & Administrative Functions:

 

  • Serve as a central point of contact for project-related phone calls and emails, directing inquiries to the appropriate team member.
  • Order and maintain office and project supplies.
  • Assist with onboarding new project team members and subcontractors, ensuring all required paperwork is completed.
  • Support accounting with processing invoices and GRs.
  • Provide administrative support to the department
  • Liaise with other department stakeholders regarding any requests in a timely manner
  • Any other adhoc tasks as necessary

 

  1. Compliance & Safety:

 

  • Help maintain and track safety compliance documentation, including training records, incident reports, and SDS (Safety Data Sheets).
  • Ensure all subcontractors have provided current certificates of insurance and other required pre-qualification documents.

 

  1. ESG:
  1. Environmental (E):
  • Data Collection & Management: Collect, verify, and input site data related to energy consumption, water usage, waste generation (and diversion rates), material sourcing, and air quality.
  • Documentation Support: Maintain records for environmental permits, inspections, and compliance documentation (e.g., stormwater pollution prevention plans, spill prevention).
  • Reporting: Assist in preparing data for sustainability certifications and internal/environmental reporting.
  • Administrative Logistics: Coordinate logistics for waste management, recycling programs, and hazardous material handling. Schedule and document environmental training for site staff.
  1. Social (S):
  • Community & Stakeholder Support: Administer documentation related to community engagement activities, grievance logs, and stakeholder communications.
  • Health & Safety Administration: Support the team by maintaining records of safety training, incident reports (with a focus on root cause documentation), and well-being program participation.
  • Diversity & Inclusion: Track and report on metrics related to workforce diversity, local hiring, and supplier diversity programs. Assist with onboarding materials for social responsibility policies.
  1. Governance (G):
  • Policy & Compliance: Ensure project documentation aligns with company ESG policies, client requirements, and relevant regulations.
  • Ethics & Supply Chain: Support the administration of supplier pre-qualification questionnaires focused on ESG criteria. Maintain records of supplier code of conduct acknowledgments.
  • Internal Controls: Manage the filing and organization of audit trails, meeting minutes (e.g., site sustainability committee), and corrective action plans related to ESG performance.
  • Risk Management: Assist in maintaining the ESG risk register for the project.

 

 

REQUIREMENT AND QUALIFICATIONS

  1. Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in construction management, Civil Engineering, Project Management, or related field.
  2. Minimum 2–5 years’ experience in construction administration, project coordination, or related role.
  3. Exposure to ESG reporting and compliance is advantageous.
  4. Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced retail environment.
  5. Strong organizational, documentation, and record-keeping skills.
  6. Ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  7. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with stakeholders at all levels.
  8. Knowledge of construction processes, procurement procedures, and safety regulations.
  9. Proactive problem-solving and coordination skills.
  10. Goal-oriented team player

title: Business Process Transformation Specialist
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Business Process Transformation? 

The challenge is to: 

  • Requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation
  • Prioritize requirements and obtained buy off from stakeholders
  • Strong Cost/Benefit focus to ensure effort is focused on true business value
  • Translate business requirements into technical requirements.
  • Design high level process and technology solution
  • Verify final technology solutions and obtained signed off from business users
  • Test the solution
  • Support User Acceptance Test
  • Liaise effectively with technical team


Do you have experience in POS? 

  • Strong experience with POS & Store Operation processes
  • Creative and willing to drive change including being well-organized and able to work independently.
  • Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
  • The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
  • Excellent documentation skills
  • Strong business and/or systems analysis experience including business process mapping, defining requirements/user stories, solution design and implementation.
  • Familiar with managing external vendors and able to communicate with users across all levels
  • Experience working in a highly matrixed organisation
  • Demonstrates a strong awareness of the uses of retail technologies within the industry sector and specifically within competitive or associated organisations operating in the same market
  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience working in sizable company with a key role in supply chain.
  • Good command of written and spoken English, Cantonese and Putonghua/Mandarin speaking

title: Product Development Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in fresh food product development?

  • Ready-to-eat fresh food categories (RTE)
  • Understand customers’ needs and formulate the corresponding range, space, buying and pricing strategies for the assigned ready-to-eat fresh food categories to maximize customers’ satisfaction and thus category performance
  • Ensure efficient and profitable management of the product development process including supplier liaison, price negotiation, innovating packaging, cost management, marketing and establishing operational and merchandising guidelines.
  • Leverage market data, analysis and category insights to identify business opportunities and enable a sustainable growth of the assigned categories
  • Cultivate strategic partnerships with suppliers and employ negotiation tactics to optimize terms
  • Collaborate with both external and internal stakeholders to facilitate the execution of the category plans and activities
  • Assist in ad hoc projects and tasks as assigned


Do you have experience in product development?

  • University degree in Business, Purchasing or Food related disciplines
  • 3-5 years experience in retail, food industry or catering services with solid experience in product development and category management metrics/ technique
  • Understand local retail market and experience in trade / business negotiation
  • Strong negotiation skills with good analytical mind and business acumen
  • Creative, detail minded with excellent communication skills and can work independently
  • Self-motivated, be able to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines
  • Proficient in both spoken and written English and Chinese
  • A good team player with strong project planning and influencing skills
  • Knowledge on food safety & quality and hygiene system, e.g. HACCP, ISO22000 is an advantage

title: Category Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management?

  • RTE category; Bakery, national brands
  • Develop and implement merchandise, buying, and pricing strategies for assigned categories to boost penetration, drive sales and margin growth, strengthen competitive positioning, and seize market opportunities. 
  • Execute and assess merchandising initiatives and category plans aligned with customer interests and preferences. 
  • Maintain optimal stock levels through effective promotion planning and inventory management. 
  • Source products locally and internationally with a strong understanding of market trends and consumer demand. 
  • Preparing and communicating the promotion schedules to the Commercial team and internal stakeholders.
  • Utilize analytics tools to provide a timely review of all promotional effectiveness, provide recommendations and action plans for improvement.
  • Establish and nurture long-term strategic partnerships with vendors to support sustainable business growth. Connect to new suppliers for new partnership opportunities, shape decisions about products, pricing, and promotional strategies. 

 

Do you have experience in Buying and Merchandising?

  • University graduate or tertiary education  
  • 3 -5 years retail merchandising experience  
  • Analytical, creative, customer-focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated 
  • Strong negotiation, project management and relationship-building skills 
  • Good communication skills and good command of English and Chinese
  • Knowledge of category management

title: 兼職顧客關係助理 Part Time Customer Relations Co-worker
description_html:
你將會愛上宜家家居

我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。

 

這會是你嗎?

  • 你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先
  • 你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作 
  • 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠 
  • 你能操流利粵語及普通英語 
  • 你擁有中三程度或以上學歷
  • 歡迎對零售業充滿熱誠的你加入我們

 

你的日常工作

  • 確保貨場購物工具充足及定時作補充，從而提供最佳顧客購物體驗
  • 吸引顧客再次到訪宜家家居 
  • 於入口歡迎及指引顧客，並派發購物袋或宣傳單張 
  • 了解顧客需要並解答各項查詢 
  • 為顧客處理付款與退換貨

 

我們團隊的使命

我們團隊致力於創造愉快、方便、成功的購物體驗並提升產品銷量，實現長期可持續盈利

 

員工福利

集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金

  • 你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先
  • 你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作
  • 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠
  • 你能操流利粵語及普通英語
  • 你熟悉一般電腦運作
  • 你擁有中五或以上學歷

你的日常工作

  • 了解宜家家居產品的功能、本地市場以及顧客需求，為顧客介紹及建議合適產品及解決方案，從而提高負責部門的銷售量
  • 提供最佳顧客購物體驗，為顧客提供滿意的服務
  • 確保貨場內貨品展示整潔、存貨充足及標價正確
  • 使用系統分析銷售空間容量，以確保庫存充足
  • 主動了解有關宜家家居的產品，解決方案，政策及操作程序的更新
  • 與配送中心協調及安排送貨和收貨等事宜 
  • 接收、盤點及處理所有進出分店之貨物及其文件 
  • 以唧車將貨物分類及上架

 

我們團隊的使命

我們團隊致力於創造愉快、方便、成功的購物體驗並提升產品銷量，實現長期可持續盈利

title: Retail Marketing Project Assistant Manager
description_html:
Is that your next challenge in Marketing Team?


The challenge is to: 


  • Understand the brand identity and translates this to excellence in execution at stores
  • Liaise with store design team on new store project management – from concept development to stakeholder alignment
  • Bring in store digitalization ideas and the implementation follow-ups
  • Assist in setting up strategies to enhance customer experience at stores, including new excitement and POSM improvement
  • Assist Retail Marketing in driving guideline and store simplification so to maintain brand consistency at store and maximize operational efficiency


Do you have experience in the Retail / FMCG industry?

  • Bachelor degree in Marketing/ Business Administration or related disciplines
  • Minimum 5 years of marketing experience, experience in store revamp project is preferred
  • Visual Merchandise experience will be a plus
  • Strong in stakeholder management, self- motivated with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Creative, adaptable, high learning agility
  • Well-organized, enjoy working in fast paced organization
  • Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese
  • Experienced in FMCG or retail industry is an absolute advantage

title: Trade Marketing Specialist
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Trade Marketing?

 

The challenge is to:

  • Develop and execute signature marketing collectable programs to enhance brand loyalty
  • Work with different external stakeholders – including media agencies, creative and production houses, for media planning, product and promotional materials development 
  • Design and implement content development (eDM, Digital, Social and other channels) to arouse program awareness
  • Support in providing data for measuring program effectiveness
  • Executing localized store promotions, including new/ revamped/ specific store group initiatives

 

Do you have experience in marketing?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing/ Business Administration or related disciplines
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in marketing, with experience in FMCG or retail industry is an absolute advantage
  • Self-motivated, multi-tasking and attention to detail
  • Proactive, able to work independently in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
  • Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese
  • Immediate availability is highly preferred

title: Store Compliance Clerk
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in store compliance?

As part of the company’s Compliance Team, we are hiring a Store Compliance Clerk. You will be a key member, independently visiting stores across different districts to objectively verify their strict adherence to company Standard Operating Procedures based on provided checklists. Your professionalism, attention to detail, and impartiality are crucial for upholding operational standards and compliance.

The challenge is to:

  • Conduct systematic reviews of store operations using standardized checklists provided by the Compliance Team to ensure adherence to SOP.
  • Apply basic Excel functions (e.g., sorting, filtering, PiviotTables) to process data and assist in identifying potential areas of findings.
  • Exercise independent judgment to identify on-site non-compliance issues; accurately and objectively complete daily compliance reports and upload them to the compliance system for documentation & reporting.
  • Clearly communicate inspection findings and explain SOP requirements to store manager.
  • Strictly adhere to team instructions, gather frontline feedback, and assist in refining checklists and SOPs.
  • Travel daily to multiple districts as required by operational needs.


Do you have experience in a retail frontline environment / inspection?

  • Secondary school graduation or equivalent.
  • Minimum 3 years in the retail experience.
  • Basic English reading and writing skills to comprehend SOPs and related documents written in English.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel for reporting and analysis, and ability to use email and mobile office applications effectively.
  • Integrity, reliability, and attentive to detail with good communication skills. Uphold compliance principles, able to strictly follow checklists and team instructions while exercising independent judgment in the field.

title: 存貨及供貨助理 Sales and Supply Support Specialist
description_html:
你將會愛上宜家家居

我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。

 

這會是你嗎?

  • 你擁有良好的分析能力
  • 你成熟主動，有自信和獨立
  • 你喜歡與人溝通和擁有良好的組織能力
  • 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠
  • 你具備良好的英語、粵語和普通話會話及書面表達能力
  • 你精通一般電腦運作(例如MS Word和Excel)
  • 你擁有中六或以上程度

 

你的日常工作

  • 確保門市的存貨供應穩定、準確以及充足給客人選購以提高銷售額
  • 因應存貨供應的問題與銷售團隊和貨倉進行協調
  • 定期進行貨品盤點以確保存貨量準確無誤
  • 協助銷售部門計劃預測貨品銷售量、分析及管理貨埸的銷售空間和訂購貨存
  • 更新存貨系統以確保貨存量準確

 

我們團隊的使命

我們團隊主要於幕後支援，確保大眾能於貨場選購所需的宜家產品，並且利用我們於供應流程的專業知識來預測和訂貨，將成本降到最低

 

全職員工福利

每月銷售獎金、年終雙糧、每月6至7天休息日、17天公眾假期、有薪假期 (如：12-18天年假、14星期產假、5天侍產假、1星期婚假)、員工醫療保險、免供款退休計劃、集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金、良好晉升機會等

title: 顧客關係助理 Customer Relations Co-worker
description_html:
你將會愛上宜家家居

我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。

 

這會是你嗎?

  • 你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先
  • 你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作 
  • 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠 
  • 你能操流利粵語及普通英語 
  • 你擁有中三程度或以上學歷

你的日常工作

  • 確保貨場購物工具充足及定時作補充，從而提供最佳顧客購物體驗
  • 吸引顧客再次到訪宜家家居 
  • 於入口歡迎及指引顧客，並派發購物袋或宣傳單張 
  • 了解顧客需要並解答各項查詢 
  • 為顧客處理付款與退換貨

 

我們團隊的使命

title: Category Manager (Digital – Fresh Online)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in eCommerce?

The challenge is to:


·       Build the commercial strategy and eCommerce trade plan for the fresh food category

·       Conduct market analysis to understand dynamics in Hong Kong and globally, identifying emerging trends and opportunities to enhance our eCommerce offerings and drive customer engagement

·       Collaborate with the Retail Technology Asia team to create engaging eCommerce assets designed to drive sales and income through enhanced product visibility and promotional activities

·       Establish efficient processes and governance models to ensure streamlined cross-functional collaboration and effective communication among teams

·       Lead initiatives that enhance O2O collaboration with the fresh food team, aiming to create a seamless customer experience

·       Utilize data analytics to identify growth opportunities within the online fresh food category, focusing on customer preferences, purchasing behavior, and competitive analysis


Do you have experience in Food Category Management?

·       Minimum 3-year working experience related to e-commerce / merchandising / commercial / start-ups

·       Degree holder

·       A passion for digital and e-commerce

·       An entrepreneurial mindset

·       Good communication and presentation skills, good team player to work with different cross-functional teams and third parties with strong problem-solving skill

·       Self-motivated, organized and comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

·       Responsible and committed to meet tight deadlines

  • 安全地操作各種廚房用具和設備及確保廚房時刻整潔

title: Category Manager (Beauty)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management?

The challenge is to:

  • Work with vendors to build mutually beneficial relationships to ensure long term strategic partnerships, leading to sales and market share growth, lower costs and higher margins.
  • Work with vendors to build and implement best-in-class category plans including new brand or product launch plans, promotion plans and marketing plans.
  • Work closely with the marketing team to develop attractive and exciting promotional events which follow pre-agreed selling plans.
  • Collaborate with relevant teams for store layouts, promotions and display techniques are effective in maximizing sales and profitability for the category.
  • Establish and maintain effective margin and price controls which enhance business profits whilst delivering a good value offer to the customer.
  • Lead stock levels and mark-downs to ensure that product availability remains high and product lifecycle is optimally managed.
  • Lead and develop a category management team, ensuring that they are customer and product focused at all times

Do you have experience in FMCG?

  • University graduate or equivalent experience
  • At least 7 years proven category management, key account management or own brand management in FMCG industry
  • Self-motivated and possessing strong problem-solving skills
  • Strong influencing, negotiation and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical thinking and possessing acute market sense
  • Proficiency in English and Chinese
  • Category management, key account management or own brand experience in health & beauty industry is preferred

你將會愛上宜家家居
我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。
這會是你嗎?
你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先
你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作
你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠
你能操流利粵語及普通英語
你熟悉一般電腦運作
你擁有中五或以上學歷
歡迎對零售業充滿熱誠的你加入我們
你的日常工作
了解宜家家居產品的功能、本地市場以及顧客需求，為顧客介紹及建議合適產品及解決方案，從而提高負責部門的銷售量
提供最佳顧客購物體驗，為顧客提供滿意的服務
確保貨場內貨品展示整潔、存貨充足及標價正確
使用系統分析銷售空間容量，以確保庫存充足
主動了解有關宜家家居的產品，解決方案，政策及操作程序的更新
與配送中心協調及安排送貨和收貨等事宜
接收、盤點及處理所有進出分店之貨物及其文件
以唧車將貨物分類及上架
我們團隊的使命
我們團隊致力於創造愉快、方便、成功的購物體驗，並提升產品銷量以實現長期可持續盈利
員工福利
集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金
歡迎 WhatsApp
9375 1657
遞交申請
申請者提供之資料絕對保密，申請人之資料只供DFI零售集團附屬機構或授權之代理人作招聘及甄選用途。招聘過程完畢後，申請資料將被保留二十四個月作參考之用。本公司已備有一份「私隱政策聲明」，閣下如有需要可瀏覽公司網頁或以書面形式向人力資源部索取有關資料。申請人如在遞交申請表後六星期內仍未接獲通知約見，其有關申請將被存檔，以作日後同類型職位空缺考慮之用。

metadata.Site: Causeway Bay/ Sha Tin /Tai Po/ Tsuen Wan/ Kowloon Bay

title: Category Manager (Meat)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management?

The challenge is to:

  • Develop and implement merchandise, buying, and pricing strategies for assigned categories to boost penetration, drive sales and margin growth, strengthen competitive positioning, and seize market opportunities.
  • Execute and assess merchandising initiatives and category plans aligned with customer interests and preferences.
  • Maintain optimal stock levels through effective promotion planning and inventory management.
  • Source products locally and internationally with a strong understanding of market trends and consumer demand. 
  • Preparing and communicating the promotion schedules to the Commercial team and internal stakeholders. 
  • Utilize analytics tools to provide a timely review of all promotional effectiveness, provide recommendations and action plans for improvement.
  • Establish and nurture long-term strategic partnerships with vendors to support sustainable business growth. Connect to new suppliers for new partnership opportunities, shape decisions about products, pricing, and promotional strategies.

 

 

Do you have experience in Merchandising or Buying?

 

  • University graduate or tertiary education  
  • 3 -5 years retail merchandising experience  
  • Knowledge of category management
  • Analytical, creative, customer-focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated
  • Strong negotiation, project management and relationship-building skills
  • Good communication skills and good command of English and Chinese

title: Digital Analytics Senior Associate
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Digital Retail?

The challenge is to:

  • Data Analysis - Analysis of sales data, customer behaviour data and online traffic patterns to inform decision-making and drive strategic insights. 
  • Performance reporting - Develop and maintain comprehensive reporting systems for Digital business performance metrics.
  • Insights generation - Identify trends and provide actionable insights to enhance marketing and operational strategies. 
  • Data Governance - Ensure data integrity across the analytics process
  • Retail media performance and Insights: Take ownership of retail media tracking, reporting and analysis. Serve as the data support lead for retail media campaigns, demonstrating campaign value and shopper insights. 

 

Do you have experience in Analytics?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Statistics or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in data analytics or a relevant role, ideally within an e-commerce, digital or CRM field.
  • Proficient in statistical analysis software and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Google Analytics)
  • Strong problem-solving capabilities, with a proactive attitude toward identifying issues and implementing effective solutions.
  • Ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams and foster a collaborative environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to clearly articulate complex data insights to diverse audiences.

title: Senior Accountant
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in inventory accounting?

The challenge is to:

  • Provide support to team head on daily operations related to inventory.
  • Perform month end closing and prepare journal related to inventory in SAP FICO.
  • Support ERP implementation to satisfy internal control and financial reporting requirements.
  • Prepare monthly analysis, reports, and accounting schedules.
  • Support on ad hoc analysis/projects related to new business initiative.

 

Do you have experience in inventory accounting?

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related disciplines.
  • Minimum 3 years of working experience in accounting. Experience in retail or trading sector highly preferred.
  • Good command of written and verbal English and Chinese.
  • Experienced user of MS Excel, PowerPoint and SAP preferred.

title: Store Manager Trainee 見習經理
description_html:
「見習經理計劃」為計劃參加者提供一系列的專業培訓，以及多元化而實用的課堂培訓和店舖實習，讓見習經理能夠獨立和擁有足夠能力以營運店舖，逐步發展零售事業。完成為期6-9個月培訓和成功通過評核後，可晉升為店務副經理。

主要職責：

  • 負責店舖日常運作，包括收銀理貨、貨品陳列、店舖整潔及顧客服務等
  • 協助經理管理分店各方面之表現及日常運作，包括顧客服務、貨品管理、人才培訓、分店環境管理及成本控制、有效地執行公司的宣傳推廣策略及貨品陳列計劃等
  • 工作時間：每週工作6天，每天9小時 (包括用膳時間)，輪班輪休
  • 工作地點：港九新界


 入職條件︰

  • 中六或以上程度，或具資歷架構同等資歷 ，無須經驗 (歡迎轉職人士及畢業生申請)
  • 具領導才能，富責任心
  • 熱愛零售行業，樂於為顧客服務
  • 良好溝通技巧及勇於接受挑戰

 

薪酬 每月可達$18,700

(完成培訓晉升為店務副經理，薪酬可達HK$20,200)

福利可享 銷售獎金、通宵班津貼、年終雙糧、12天有薪年假、17天公眾假期、集團購物優惠、超時工作津貼、特別地區津貼、跨區津貼、員工及家屬醫療優惠（中西醫、跌打及牙醫）、有薪婚假及免供款退休計劃等

 

如有興趣申請者，歡迎親臨本公司招聘中心進行面試。(無須預約)

招聘中心地址：

荔枝角長順街七號西頓中心八樓
(荔枝角港鐵站A出口)

招聘中心開放時間：

上午九時至下午五時 (午膳：下午十二時三十分至下午一時三十分)星期一至五, 公眾假期除外

 如有查詢，請WhatsApp至 (852) 6657 8720 (https://wa.me/85266578720)。

title: Assistant Store Manager/ Store Manager 店務副經理 / 店務經理
description_html:
主要職責：

  • 獨立/協助經理處理店舖決策性的事務，管理分店各方面之表現及日常運作，包括顧客服務、貨品管理、人才培訓、分配人手、店舖保安、分店環境管理及成本控制等
  • 透過有效地執行公司的宣傳推廣策略、貨品陳列計劃及維持高水平的食物衛生標準
  • 工作時間: 上午9時至下午6時，每週工作6天，逢星期日休息

 入職條件︰

  • 中六或以上程度
  • 三年以上零售管理經驗
  • 具領導才能，富責任心
  • 熱愛零售行業，樂於為顧客服務
  • 良好溝通技巧及勇於接受挑戰

 

薪酬 每月可達$20,200-21,600

福利可享 銷售獎金、通宵班津貼、年終雙糧、12天有薪年假、17天公眾假期、集團購物優惠、超時工作津貼、特別地區津貼、跨區津貼、員工及家屬醫療優惠（中西醫、跌打及牙醫）、有薪婚假及免供款退休計劃等

 

如有興趣申請者，歡迎親臨本公司招聘中心進行面試。(無須預約)

荔枝角長順街七號西頓中心八樓
(荔枝角港鐵站A出口)

上午九時至下午五時 (午膳：下午十二時三十分至下午一時三十分)星期一至五, 公眾假期除外

 如有查詢，請WhatsApp至 (852) 6657 8720 (https://wa.me/85266578720)。

metadata.Name: Assistant Store Manager/ Store Manager 店務副經理 / 店務經理

title: 銷售助理 Sales Co-worker (澳門分店 Macau Taipa Store)
description_html:
你將會愛上宜家家居

我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。

 

這會是你嗎?

  • 你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先
  • 你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作
  • 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠
  • 你能操流利粵語及普通英語
  • 你熟悉一般電腦運作
  • 你擁有中五或以上學歷
  • 歡迎對零售業充滿熱誠的應屆畢業生加入我們

 

你的日常工作

  • 了解宜家家居產品的功能、本地市場以及顧客需求，為顧客介紹及建議合適產品及解決方案，從而提高負責部門的銷售量
  • 提供最佳顧客購物體驗，為顧客提供滿意的服務
  • 確保貨場內貨品展示整潔、存貨充足及標價正確
  • 使用系統分析銷售空間容量，以確保庫存充足
  • 主動了解有關宜家家居的產品，解決方案，政策及操作程序的更新

 

我們團隊的使命

我們團隊致力於創造愉快、方便、成功的購物體驗，並提升產品銷量以實現長期可持續盈利

 

員工福利

集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金

 

申請者提供之資料絕對保密，申請人之資料只供DFI零售集團附屬機構或授權之代理人作招聘及甄選用途。招聘過程完畢後，申請資料將被保留二十四個月作參考之用。本公司已備有一份「私隱政策聲明」，閣下如有需要可瀏覽公司網頁或以書面形式向人力資源部索取有關資料。申請人如在遞交申請表後六星期內仍未接獲通知約見，其有關申請將被存檔，以作日後同類型職位空缺考慮之用。

metadata.Name: 銷售助理 Sales Co-worker (澳門分店 Macau Taipa Store)

title: Financial Analyst, yuu Rewards
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in financial analysis? 

The challenge is to: 


  • Partner directly with project managers and digital leads as the finance representative on key strategic yuu and digital initiatives. 
  • Manage the end-to-end project financial lifecycle, from initial budget creation to monthly forecasting and actual spend tracking. 
  • Prepare monthly and quarterly financial performance packs for the leadership team, highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities. 
  • Provide financial guidance and support to the yuu and digital teams, helping them understand their financial performance and make data-driven decisions. 
  • Support on annual and quarterly forecasting processes. 
  • Monitor and support month end closing, propose journal entries, reconciliations and working with shared service providers for the loyalty PL. 
  • Perform other ad-hoc analysis and additional related duties as assigned. 

 

Do you have experience in financial analysis?  

  • Bachelor's degree in one or more of the following degrees: Business, Accounting, Commerce or similar qualifications. 
  • A CA/CPA/CIMA professional qualification. 
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant finance experience working in both a “Big 4” accounting firm and/or sophisticated and fast paced commercial organizations, preferably within supermarket retail sector or digital sectors. 
  • Less experienced candidates will be considered for the position of Financial Analyst. 
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (PivotTables, Power Query, complex formulas) and PowerPoint 
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau). 
  • Prior experience in tech, digital, or loyalty program finance is a significant advantage. 
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders. 
  • Good business sense, analytical skills and an inquisitive mind. 
  • Proficiency in both spoken and written English

title: Category Executive
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management?

  • Assist Category Manager to manage the assigned product category 

  • Arrange logistic, stock allocation and return of purchased products 

  • Coordinate with vendors to implement promotion plan and promotional display for stores 

  • Maintain business transaction records and product inventories control 

  • Support the team to prepare categories sales analysis and system data maintenance 

  • Build a good relationship with internal teams to facilitate smooth operations  

  • Provide routine administrative support, e.g. new vendor/new item creation, follow up of item launching and promotion plan, etc. 

 

Do you have experience in Buying and Merchandising?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business related disciplines 

  • Minimum 1-2 years of relevant experience in buying 

  • Passionate about retail, food products and sales-driven 

  • Team player with good interpersonal skills 

  • High accuracy in data input 

  • Proficient in MS Office and Chinese Word Processing  

  • Good command of both spoken and written English & Chinese 

  • Immediate availability is preferred

title: Category Support Executive (Temp)
description_html:
Role Purpose:

You are responsible to provide administrative and analytical support to the team. In the course of your work, you will liaise with suppliers, operations and marketing departments to ensure smooth execution of product listing and promotion. In addition, you will provide timely and accurate reports and analysis to the management.

Responsibilities

  • Prepare and submit all system maintenance forms before the cut-off time
  • Prepare payment requisition
  • Prepare monthly billing for claims/promotion/new product listings, & etc
  • Liaise with suppliers on promotions forms and claims and settle discrepancies
  • Prepare and compile agency format for submission to marketing, store bulletin and letter of authorization to vendors
  • Prepare sales report and analysis for Merchandise Manager and Category Manager
  • Prepare promotion listing via securing support, consolidation and running tool
  • Prepare slides presentation and meeting
  • Any other ad-hoc administrative tasks

 

Requirements

  • Diploma in Business Management
  • Min 1 year of relevant experience in retail or FMCG industry
  • Dynamic, self-motivated and able to work under pressure
  • Possess excellent communication (spoken and written) and interpersonal skills 
  • Proficient in MS Excel (pivot/lookup functions) and Powerpoint
  • Basic analysis on data and ability to prepare automated templates/dashboard (optional)

title: Space, Range, Display Senior Manager
description_html:
Space, Range, Display Senior Manager


Is this your next challenge in Retail / FMCG?

This role leads the strategic and operational execution of both macro and micro space planning, range optimization, and display effectiveness across the retail network. The Senior Space, Range, Display Manager is expected to balance financial performance with customer-centric design, translating corporate wellness and health-led initiatives into actionable in-store experiences. The role requires strong stakeholder engagement across commercial, operations, design, and supplier teams.

 

The challenge is to:


Macro & Micro Space Management 

  • Oversee macro space planning including floor plan development, store zoning, and space rebalancing for new and refit stores. 
  • Lead micro space optimization through planogram execution, bay allocation, and fixture planning. 
  • Apply space productivity models to refine space allocation and improve space productivity 

 

Range & Display Optimization 

  • Drive range rationalization cycles to streamline assortment and improve operational efficiency. 
  • Align category space and display strategies with commercial priorities 
  • Support newness initiatives and category innovation through curated display zones and educational fixtures. 
  • Continuously refine SOPs and data transparency tools to support decision-making for enhancing customer satisfaction and financial contribution 

 

Customer Experience & Wellness Integration 

  • Translate company direction in wellness into store-level actions, including layout enhancements, and navigation improvements 
  • Ensure store formats reflect customer shopping preferences across clusters (e.g. tourist vs. local) and support omni-channel integration

 

Stakeholder Engagement & Communication 

  • Act as a key liaison between commercial, operations, design, construction, and finance teams to ensure cohesive execution
  • Communicate SRD strategy and project updates across multiple levels of stakeholders, including senior leadership and store teams 
  • Lead cross-functional workshops and project briefings to align on priorities and timeline

 

Project & Performance Management 

  • Manage SRD project timelines, scope, and deliverables including equipment rollout, bay changes, and supplier fixture coordination 
  • Track and report on SRD-related budget achievements and space-driven sales uplift 
  • Continuously refine SOPs and data transparency tools to support decision-making and store performance tracking


Do you have experience in Space, Range and Display? 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field; MBA is a plus
  • Minimum 8 years of experience in trade marketing, or commercial, preferably within FMCG or retail sectors
  • Strong commercial acumen and negotiation skills
  • Deep understanding of the Hong Kong retail landscape and supplier dynamics
  • Strong project management and cross-functional leadership capabilities
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Cantonese

title: Assistant Category Manager (Health)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in category management?

  • To liaise with Marketing Department about developing attractive and interesting promotional events which follow pre-agreed selling plan
  • To work closely with retail and sales management to ensure that store layouts, promotions and display techniques are effective in maximizing sales and profit from the specific merchandise categories
  • To establish and maintain effective margin and price controls which maximize business profits whilst delivering a good value offer to the customer
  • To negotiate and work with vendors to build mutually beneficial relationships to ensure long term strategic partnership, leading to lower costs and higher margin
  • To manage stock levels and mark-downs to ensure that product availability is high
  • To develop and train subordinates ensuring that they are customer and product focused


Do you have experience in category management?

  •  University graduate
  •  At least 3 years solid category management, trade marketing, or account servicing experience in FMCG industry
  • Strong influencing, negotiation and communication skills
  • Good analytical skill, well-planned and acute market sense
  • Proficiency in English and Chinese
  • With category management experience of personal care, beauty or health is preferred

title: Junior Business Analyst
description_html:
Major accountabilities

  • Collaborate with different business stakeholders to identify potential business needs in the digital transformation journey
  • Drive cross-department workshops to define forward looking business requirements
  • Work closely with both business and technology team to create a prioritized backlog of requirements based on business value
  • Collaborate with UIUX team to ensure the usability needs are met and requirements are reflected appropriately
  • Work closely with technical development teams to provide functional inputs for system impact analysis and clarify questions as needed
  • Serve as a functional expert in the e-commerce domain, providing guidance on best practices during the requirement gathering phase
  • Assist in performing market analysis and benchmarking on key business areas to understand gap compared to competition on business focus areas
  • Assist in user on-boarding operation training as needed

 

Skills & Experience Required

  • University Graduate and above
  • Ability to speak in business and technology terms, as well as the ability to effectively communicate both internally and externally
  • Must possess good problem-solving skills for large complicated and broad issues and able to work independently, with keen attention to details
  • Must be able to break problems down, analyze data, drill into problem statements, ask the right questions to really understand root causes and then solution around issue to drive business value.
  • 3+ years’ experience in sizable digital transformation projects or large organizations acting in the capacity of a Business Analyst
  • Min 2 years of experience in FMCG (Ecommerce team will be a plus) with proven experience as Business Analyst in customer digital journey would be required
  • Experience in Project Management Toolsets (e.g. Jira) would be an advantage
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and inter-personnel skills
  • Proficient in both spoken & written English and Chinese
