title: Senior Category Manager (Health Care)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Category Management (Health Care)?

The challenge is to:

Strategic        

  • Develop and implement the merchandise, buying and pricing strategies for the designated category management teams, in line with the agreed company vision and mission.  To increase category penetration, trade up customers, develop competitive edges and to capitalize market opportunities.
  • Assist Director to contirbute to the formation of Company strategy and develop relevant tactics.
  • Formulate and lead the team to implement the healthcare development plan to capitalize the market opportunities
  • Keep abreast of the retail environment by paying regular visits to stores, to competitors and also internationally and initiate appropriate decisions /actions to ensure competitive advantage is maintained. 
  • Keep abreast on the development of the industry reform in HK to capitalize business opportunities.                                

Sales and Profit

  • Generate sales by ensuring that Mannings target customers are provided with products and services that they want.
  • Establish and maintain a margin and pricing policy which maximises business profits whilst delivering a good value offer to the customer.
  • Negotiate the best terms with suppliers by creating and building strong mutually beneficial partnership relationships.
  • Build value creating partnership relationships with the vendor base.
  • Maximise other income generation from the vendor base.                                                                                                                   

Stock 

  • Manage stock levels and mark downs to ensure that product availability is high yet ensure that cash flows and profits are maximised by controlling stock levels within set targets.
  • Establish and maintain effective SKU control and tail management.                                                                                                                  

Customer Focus

  • Work closely with Ops team, supply chain team, pharmacist team and marketing team to roll-out and evaluate merchandising activities and category plans which are customer focused in offering interesting and innovative promotional activities and events to increase sales, profits and foot- traffic.
  • Continuously review the product category mix to ensure that customers’ needs are fully satisfied at all times.
  • To lead the category management teams to develop appropriate CRM strategies to improve customers' loyalty and to maximize promotion returns.                                                                                                                

People

  • Develop and train subordinates ensuring that they are customer and product focused.
  • Manage performance through the setting and reviewing of individuals’ performance.
  • Build an effective and open working relationship both within the Merchandise Department and with other Departments.
  • Provide counsel and guidance to category managers in category management matters

Do you have experience in FMCG?

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • 10-12 years proven category management, key account management or own brand management in FMCG industry
  • Health background experience an advantage
  • Demonstrated strategic thinking skills
  • Proven ability to influence, with strong analytical skills
  • Customer-focused, adaptable to change, and highly organised
  • Excellent negotiation and communication abilities
  • Extensive sourcing network within the industry
  • Strong market awareness and acute commercial sense

title: Customer Marketing Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Customer Marketing?

Integrated Marketing Communication Planning 
 • Drive planning and execution on the annual marketing calendar, aligning category strategy with customer activation across 360 media touchpoints, both ATL and in-store
 • Crafting communication and promotion content across categories and channels, working closely with the commercial team to strengthen the branding while driving business performance

Category Marketing Management 
 • Develop consumer-centric communication strategies by translating category-specific insights into compelling narratives that align with shopper missions and brand objectives
 • Build tailored messaging frameworks for diverse audience segments, addressing distinct user behaviours and purchase drivers across channels
 • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to story-tell product assortments through integrated campaigns, ensuring consistency in tone and purpose
 • Developing insightful and trend-based customer activations that uncover opportunities for Mannings to connect customers with our quality category offers and services with integrated marketing solutions in omnichannel
 • Supporting Customer Marketing Head to drive ONE integrated trade marketing calendar; collaborating with cross-functional collaborators, mainly merchandising, operations, CRM and e-Commerce teams
 • Supervising and analysing the competition communication activities and anticipating their future moves

Promotion Management 
 • Interpreting customer and shopper behaviour to define the promotions’ objectives with alignment of category and marketing strategies, selecting cross / up-selling techniques, involving suppliers when relevant, and focusing on the development of uniqueness and differentiating promotion experiences
 • Being responsible for the promotion process, ensuring the respect of promotion milestones, planning and budget, the product availability and the visual presentation of the offer to customers

Activation Management
 • Being responsible for the event calendar and owning the execution of the key events across categories and channels
 • Coordinating the development of new events, focusing on the creation of an exciting, outstanding customer experience, which will boost the customer’s sense of engagement with the brand

Performance Optimization
 • Work closely with Digital and CRM functions to develop effective customer engagement programs with internal and external collaborators
 • Work closely with Brand Marketing and Digital and CRM functions to develop effective mediums and touchpoints throughout the customer journey including TVC, print advertisement and instore POSM for both national and store-level activities 
 • With an understanding of the mix of marketing channels, optimising the efficiency of each channel 
 • Work closely with Commercial team in analysing business performance with communication and promotion

Stakeholder Leadership
 • Act as the bridge between Commercial, Ops, and Suppliers, ensuring alignment from planning to execution
 • Mentor junior team members in category management best practices

Do you have experience in the FMCG industry?

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing/ Business Administration or related disciplines
  • Minimum 7 years of marketing experience, especially in customer marketing / product management (Category knowledge in Beauty/ Health products is an absolute advantage)
  • Experience in the FMCG or retail industry is an absolute advantage
  • Strong in stakeholder management, self-motivated with excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
  • Creative, adaptable, high learning agility
  • Good at Story-telling and project management
  • Well-organized, enjoy working in fast-paced organisation 
  • Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese

title: Category Manager -
description_html:
The Category Manager is responsible for managing assigned product categories to achieve sales, gross profit, and income targets. This role involves developing strategic plans, executing promotional and pricing strategies, optimizing assortment and space productivity, and maintaining strong supplier partnerships. The individual must be proactive, data-driven, and adaptable to market trends and business needs.

 

Job Responsibilities

 

  • Sales & Profitability:
     Drive and achieve category sales, gross profit, and income goals by monitoring market trends and developing strategies to grow market share and counter competition.
  • Inventory Management:
     Implement effective inventory management processes to ensure an optimal product mix that meets customer needs while minimizing shrinkage.
  • Promotion Planning:
     Plan and execute promotional campaigns that create excitement and drive incremental sales in-store.
  • Merchandising & Space Management:
     Develop and implement planogram and space management strategies to improve shelf productivity, enhance customer experience, and increase category turnover.
  • Range Review & Assortment Optimization:
     Conduct regular range reviews to ensure the right assortment mix is in place to drive productivity, meet shopper needs, and eliminate underperforming SKUs.
  • Category & Brand Strategy:
     Oversee the implementation of category strategies, including the development of private label or house brand products.
  • Relationship Management:
     Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders to align on business objectives.
  • Market Insight:
     Stay updated on consumer behavior, market developments, and competitor activities to inform category strategies.
  • Pricing Strategy:
     Develop and implement competitive pricing strategies that offer value to customers while supporting profitability.
  • Supplier Collaboration:
     Establish and manage collaborative partnerships with suppliers to optimize trading terms, income opportunities, and promotional funding.
  • Reporting & Analysis:
     Prepare weekly/monthly category performance reports with actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Promotion Evaluation:
     Evaluate the effectiveness of promotional campaigns and provide insights for continuous improvement.


Job Requirements


  • Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field.
  • 4–6 years of relevant experience in retail or FMCG, preferably in a merchandising or category management role.
  • Strong understanding of customer-centric business models.
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Strong knowledge of market dynamics and consumer trends.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Excellent presentation, communication, and negotiation skills.
  • Strong analytical capabilities with the ability to translate data into insights.
  • Energetic, creative, collaborative, and highly adaptable.
  • Organized and results-driven with a proactive mindset.
  • Team player with the ability to promote cross-functional collaboration.
  • Effective in decision-making and responsive to a fast-changing environment.
  • Comfortable communicating across all levels of the organization.

title: Restaurant & Bistro Manager (Tsuen Wan Store)
description_html:
WHY YOU WILL LOVE US

We’re a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. We come from all over the world, but we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people". How we realize this vision is based on our shared humanistic values. These values guide our work and build our inclusive, open and honest culture. It’s all based on a spirit of togetherness and enthusiasm. We work hard, but we have fun doing it. We’re always looking for people who share our positive attitude and values.


 

WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU

  • You have experience of using commercial opportunities to attract visitors
  • You have experience of managing/leading and developing a team
  • You have experience of creating and executing action plans
  • You have experience of marketing and activity planning
  • You have business experience and knowledge from either IKEA Food or another part of IKEA retailing
  • You are preferably gained in an IKEA store or similar food service/hospitality environment
  • You have knowledge of the IKEA Concept, including our vision and business idea, IKEA culture and values, and how we create our business advantages
  • You are ability to read and understand written English and good communication in English
  • You are proficient in MS Office
  • You have at least 5 years of experience of management role in high volume restaurant

 

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY

  • Customers are always in focus and strive to make them smile. Meet and serve our customers showing empathy, care, listen and support them with an attitude based on the IKEA values, follow up the customer feedback regularly with action
  • Together with the team contribute actively to the development and implementation of a clear IKEA Food action plan for the store using the store business plan and country business plan. These are supported by input from Growing IKEA together and the IKEA Food Direction & Strategy
  • Work closely with Communication & Interior Design team and the Commercial Activity Leader by actively contributing to and supporting all marketing and in-store activities. Integrating the Swedish celebrations and yearly focus area into the store’s Commercial Calendar
  • To maximize commerciality to grow sales as well as the conversion rate and average check. Use other tools such as the CMP Review, customer flow and the 10 Most Frequent Questions to strengthen quality perception and customer experience
  • Co-operation with the Kitchen Production Manager, ensure following range matrix & PPSI, food displays are always fresh and look appealing with standard quality
  • Monitor, analyse and follow up the sales performance, secure the product availability and minimize the food wastage, ensure the SISAN and merchandising basic in place
  • Share to the team of the top-selling products, and that they are available and clearly communicated and always displayed
  • Co-operate with the SFM team leader to enhance the link between the Swedish restaurant and the Swedish Food Market. Take appropriate actions to promote cross merchandising/communication
  • Be a passionate leader who can bring business and people together. Inspired by the IKEA core leadership capabilities and strive to continuously develop as a leader and committed to the development of the team. Secure their training to ensure all co-workers understand the IKEA Concept and other key guidelines, and how they have an impact on their specific roles
  • Work together with the Kitchen Production Manager in the operation area according to the IKEA Quality and Food Safety requirements and implement the IKEA Hygiene plan to meet and secure the store’s requirements. Also ensure the Hygiene plan routines are known and followed in all daily work

 

TOGETHER AS A TEAM

  • To create an enjoyable, convenient and successful customer shopping and buying experience
  • Ensure that our customers are provided an irresistible food offer, in a welcoming atmosphere and neat environment that gives our customers a good reason to return

 

STAFF BENEFITS

Annual Fixed Bonus, Discretionary Bonus, 17 days Public Holiday, Paid Leave (Paid Annual Leave, 14 weeks Maternity Leave, 5 days Paternity Leave, 1 week Marriage Leave), Employee Medical Coverage, Non-Contributory Retirement Plan, Staff Purchase Discount, Birthday Coupon, Referral Bonus, Excellent Career Path


 

Personal data collected will be kept and handled confidentially by authorized personnel for recruitment purposes only. It might also be disclosed to our subsidiaries, associates and agencies authorized to process the information for appointment. The Company will retain the applications of candidates not selected for a maximum period of 24 months after the selection process is finalized. Our Personal Information Collection Statement (PICS) is available at our career site and can be provided upon request by contacting our Human Resources Department. Applicants not heard from us within six weeks may consider their applications filed for future reference.

title: Delivery Assistant (葵涌三號貨櫃碼頭)
description_html:
工作內容: 負責上落貨及運送貨物到各區分店


工作地點: 葵涌三號貨櫃碼頭


工作時間: 每週工作6天，每天工作8小時，輪休

早班︰上午7時至下午4時/上午8時至下午5時/上午9時至下午6時 或

通宵班: 晚上10時至早上7時


工作要求: 學歷經驗不拘


待遇: 可享額外出車車次津貼、額外送貨點點數津貼、年終雙糧、12天有薪年假、17天公眾假期、集團購物優惠、超時工作津貼、員工及家屬醫療優惠（中西醫、跌打及牙醫）、有薪婚假及免供款退休計劃

如有興趣申請者，請按 “申請”或親臨本公司招聘中心進行面試。(無須預約)

招聘中心地址：

荔枝角長順街七號西頓中心八樓
(荔枝角港鐵站A出口)

招聘中心開放時間：

上午九時至下午五時 (午膳：下午十二時三十分至下午一時三十分)星期一至五, 公眾假期除外

 如有查詢，請WhatsApp至 (852) 6821 5160 (https://wa.me/85268215160)。

title: Senior Manager/ Manager, Retail Media & Insight Monetization
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Retail Media?


The challenge is to:

Retail Media Monetization 

  • Own the strategy and execution of in-store advertising programs across banners, including digital screens, omni channel asset etc.
  • Drive revenue growth by packaging and selling media inventory to suppliers, ensuring optimal pricing, placement, and performance tracking.
  • Collaborate with marketing, operations, and IT teams to scale the retail media platform and ensure seamless campaign execution.
  • Work closely with Commercial team and Retail Media team for pitching and managing expectations from supplier to achieve respective budget and return

Insight & Data Commercialization 

  • Lead the development of data-sharing products (e.g., shopper behavior modules, product performance reports) for suppliers.
  • Manage supplier onboarding and engagement for insight monetization, ensuring compliance with data governance and privacy standards.
  • Work closely with analytics and CRM teams to translate customer behavior into actionable insights for supplier partners

 

Supplier Engagement 

  • Build strong relationships with key suppliers to understand their trade marketing objectives and align them with retail media and data offerings.
  • Maximize the conversion of supplier trade budgets into retail media and insight programs, with a focus on long term partnerships and ROI delivery.
  • Develop joint business plans with top suppliers to integrate media and data monetization into annual negotiations.
  • Support to organize annual supplier event to share Mannings key focus and strategies and obtain alignment with supplier support

Performance Management & Reporting 

  • Track and report on revenue performance, campaign eAectiveness, and supplier satisfaction.
  • Continuously optimize monetization strategies based on data-driven insights and market trends.
  • Present performance updates and strategic recommendations to senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders


Do you have experience in Retail and Data Analytics?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, or related field; MBA is a plus
  • Minimum 8 years of experience in retail media, trade marketing, or commercial analytics, preferably within FMCG or retail sectors
  • Proven track record in monetizing media and data assets, with strong commercial acumen and negotiation skills
  • Deep understanding of the Hong Kong retail landscape and supplier dynamics
  • Strong project management and cross-functional leadership capabilities
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Cantonese

title: Rewards Assistant Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Rewards?


The challenge is to:


Support the Group Rewards team in the design, implementation, and administration of total rewards programs. This role will contribute to compensation benchmarking, Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) operations, policy governance, and annual review processes, ensuring alignment with business strategy and market competitiveness.


  • Participate in development, review and implementation of reward related programs and projects such as salary benchmarking and benefit review.
  • Support in the annual salary review and incentive and other reward processes.
  • Manage end-to-end LTIP processes including grant cycles, vesting schedules, participant communications, and system updates.
  • Partner with the business to prepare compensation package proposals for internal mobility and new hires.
  • Review and update reward policies to ensure compliance with statutory requirements.
  • Manage and collaborate with vendors and external partners to ensure maximum value of services is delivered.
  • Provide trusted and practical advice to the business and HR team members on reward programs.


Do you have experience in Rewards?

  • Bachelor degree or equivalent
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in Rewards.
  • Strong analytical skills with ability to interpret complex data and provide insights.
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail.
  • Strong communication, influencing and collaboration skills.
  • Self-motivated with growth mindset.

title: Process Manager, Retail Data Foundation
description_html:
As the Process Analyst/Manager, Retail Data Foundation for Retail Transformation, you will play a crucial role in standardizing operating model for ERP driven processes in the retail environment. You will guide teams across HK Food, H&B, and 7E in developing and managing the future process and design across banners that enhance our Customer First, People Led and Shareholder Driven strategy, for both physical and online markets. By leveraging your expertise, you will ensure that our strategies align with business goals, programme goals and deliver exceptional value to our customers.  

 

The role will be a 3-years contract position 

 

The challenge is to:

  • Support on overall process mapping design and business alignment
  • Work with implementation partners to define the to-be process flow diagrams
  • Work with other Process teams to achieve consensus on process integration topics
  • Support Functional teams to deliver the design and identify the required testing of the to-be processes
  • Support IUT & SIT testing execution
  • Provide help and guidance to end user on data conversion decisions
  • Support user training and change management
  • Participate in UAT and data migration and train other end users on new system

 

Do you have experience with Retail Processes dominantly towards Retail Data Management?

  • 3-5 years of experience in retail processes such as commercial management of category, supplier/procurement, merchandising, promotion/loyalty program, rebate, inventory cost. 
  • Experience with food business, health and beauty or convenience store commercial and marketing functions are an advantage.
  • Experience in process harmonization or ERP system implementation is highly preferred.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
  • Good attention to detail with excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Excellent spoken and written communication in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, IT, or a related field.

title: Designer, Food
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in design?

The challenge is to:

  • Create visually compelling packaging designs that meet our brand guidelines, mainly in food and non-food categories.
  • Ensure designs meet high quality standard and deadlines
  • Develop mockups, renders and on-shelf test
  • Creative with strong design sense as well as design knowledge
  • Have a good understanding of packaging print production processes.  
  • Work efficiently, responsible and able to handle multiple projects independently
  • Stay updated on design trends

 

Do you have experience in Design?

  • Diploma or above in graphic design, commercial art and/or related fields
  • Minimum 3 - 5 years of working experience in similar position
  • Proficient in Mac in design software including Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, & MS Office and Chinese typing
  • Good communication skills in both Chinese & English
  • Applicants need to provide a Portfolio
  • Immediate availability is preferred

title: Finance Business Partner, People & Culture
description_html:
Finance Business Partner, People & Culture will be the go-to expert for all aspects of overhead labour budgeting, forecasting, and analysis. The successful candidate will provide the financial clarity and insights that underpin key business decisions on headcount and investment. 


Is this your next challenge in finance business partnering with People & Culture?

The challenge is to: 


  • Labour Budgeting & Forecasting: Independently manage end-to-end process for the annual budget and regular forecast updates for all overhead labour costs, ensuring accuracy and timeliness
  • Collaborative Planning: Work closely with P&C Business Partners and functional leaders to develop people plans, translating hiring, attrition and compensation strategies into precise financial projections.
  • Financial Analysis & Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on variances between actual labour costs and budget/forecast, investigating underlying drivers and trends to provide meaningful explanations for financial performance.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Prepare and deliver clear, concise analysis and reports to senior leadership, effectively communicating insights and recommendations.
  • Process Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities to enhance the efficiency, accuracy, and automation of workforce planning processes and reporting.


Do you have experience in FP&A / workforce planning?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Workforce Planning or a similar analytical role.
  • Proven experience managing budgeting and forecasting cycles.
  • Good command of both written and verbal English.
  • Expert proficiency in MS Excel.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
  • Strong analytical mindset, ability to interpret complex data to drive decision-making.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to collaborate with and influence business leaders.
  • Candidates with less experience will be considered to be Assistant Manager.

title: People & Culture Business Partner Lead, Food, Hong Kong & Macau
description_html:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Act as trusted business advisor and build trusted relationship with the business stakeholders and team members.

• Lead business partnering strategies including the end-to-end people transformation journey, from organization & role design, structure review, talent mapping and development, workforce planning, implementation and engagement support. Ensure the entire process managed in a value-led approach.

• Coach managers on developing their teams & managing the performance management process, building capability and identifying talents that are in consistent with our Values.

• Drive the discussion on post-engagement survey and play a partnership role in action planning working with various stakeholders, especially at store level, to drive staff engagement.

• Work with People & Culture (P&C) COEs to ensure we hire the right candidates under the recruitment and reward guidelines and principles.

• Act as the key contact point for business leaders in resolving issues relating to People, including performance management issues, employee grievances, organization design and succession planning.

• Lead and execute change management on people matters of assigned portfolio(s), including strategic planning on communication strategies and minimize any potential people risks.

• Deliver the annual salary review, bonus review and budget exercise and provide the accurate information to Finance and business leaders on timely basis.

• Deliver excellent core People & Culture processes and routines right first time, minimize grievances and complaints by ensuring people are treated with respect.


PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE/ QUALIFICATIONS

• Minimum 7 years of solid business partnering experience in a matrix organization, preferably in Retail industry.

• Proven track record working with the business leader to deliver people transformation independently.

• Strong influencing and stakeholder management.

• Well versed in HK Labour Ordinance.

• Strong ethical and compliance mindset.

• Agile, flexible and adaptable – understand the people dynamic, balance the needs on the People & Culture perspective and the business needs.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to develop and manage effective working relationships with internal and external parties across different culture.

title: Assistant Manager, O2O Projects
description_html:
The Role

 

The O2O Project Assistant Manager plays a pivotal role in driving strategic innovation initiatives that bridge Guardian's offline and online touchpoints, with a strong focus on integrated health and wellness services. This role supports the Head of Business Development in the design, execution, and scaling of pilot programs such as health assessments and digital health partnerships. The candidate will manage end-to-end project execution including business case development, internal and external stakeholder alignment, and operational integration into Guardian's omnichannel ecosystem.


Responsibilities

 

  • Support planning and execution of O2O initiatives focused on health & wellness integration:
  • Conduct feasibility studies, develop business cases and track ROI for pilot programs
  • Collaborate with internal functions (e.g. Store Ops, Tech, Marketing, Legal) and external partners (e.g. health tech providers, medical partners etc. to co-create service journeys and digital tools
  • Define clear customer experience flows across physical and digital interfaces
  • Coordinate pilot rollout plans, training materials, SOPs, and post-launch performance reviews
  • Track milestones, manage project timelines, and escalate risks to the Head of Business Development
  • Maintain proper documentation of contracts, partner deliverables and operating procedures
  • Work closely with Product and Digital Tech teams to ensure proper backend integration with the Guardian App and CDP
  • Support the Head of Business Development in crafting proposals, decks and reports for management reviews

 

About You

 

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or related fields
  • 2-3 years of relevant experience in project management, healthcare innovation, or retail O2O strategy
  • Prior involvement in digital health/wellness pilots or health &  beauty operations is a plus
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking capabilities; able to build ROI models and project justifications
  • Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, and project tracking tools
  • Excellent communication skills with proven ability to manage diverse stakeholders and external vendors
  • Able to work independently in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment

title: Senior Group Risk, Compliance and Ethics Manager
description_html:
As Senior Group Risk, Compliance and Ethics Manager, the role entails establishing a Compliance and Ethics program, promoting it across the DFI organisation and ensuring the relevant regulatory requirements and internal ethical standards are embedded into the business.

Is this your next challenge in Risk and Compliance?

1. Compliance and Ethics

  • Develop and execute a company-wide compliance and ethics program which entails but not limited to DFI’s business conduct, anti-corruption, conflict of interest and Speak Up policy and standards.
  • Collaborate with Group Legal team in developing and delivering communication, training and embedment materials in respect to ethical compliance (e.g. online training, in-person training)
  • Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g. IT, Corporate Communications, People and Culture, Finance) to implement certain aspects of DFI’s compliance and ethics program. This includes but not limited to third party due diligence and gift & entertainment.
  • Advise management on DFI’s compliance with regulatory requirement and ethics standards. Also, interpret and communicate DFI’s ethical and compliance standards to the DFI business.
  • Implement measures and prepare reports that monitor the overall effectiveness of DFI’s compliance and ethics program (e.g. annual compliance culture survey, training completion, Speak Up trend).

2. Investigations

  • Advise management on DFI’s compliance with regulatory requirement and ethics standards. Also, interpret and communicate DFI’s ethical and compliance standards to the DFI business.
  • Implement measures and prepare reports that monitor the overall effectiveness of DFI’s compliance and ethics program (e.g. annual compliance culture survey, training completion, Speak Up trend).
  • Perform investigations on matters of serious concerns when escalated by the business or raised via DFI’s Speak Up channel particularly if ethical in nature (e.g. fraud, bribery).
  • Draft and communicate to business stakeholders’ investigation results which includes identifying control deficiencies or weaknesses, fraud matters, root causes and aligned action plan.
  • Validate the aligned actions taken by management following the investigation.


Do you have experience in compliance, ethics and investigations?

  • Bachelor’s degree in law, business administration or a related field
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a Compliance, Ethics and investigations, preferably in retail industry
  • Demonstrable experience of delivery of successful compliance, business conduct and ethics programmes in a large and complex organization
  • Strong knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards
  • Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) is a strong asset
  • Experience in audit and risk management is an asset
  • Excellent verbal, written communication and report writing skills in English and Cantonese
  • Analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Attention to detail and commitment to ethical integrity
  • Project management and organizational skills

Collaborate with Group Legal team in developing and delivering communication, training and embedment materials in respect to ethical compliance (e.g. online training, in-person training)
Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g. IT, Corporate Communications, People and Culture, Finance) to implement certain aspects of DFI’s compliance and ethics program. This includes but not limited to third party due diligence and gift & entertainment.
Advise management on DFI’s compliance with regulatory requirement and ethics standards. Also, interpret and communicate DFI’s ethical and compliance standards to the DFI business.
Implement measures and prepare reports that monitor the overall effectiveness of DFI’s compliance and ethics program (e.g. annual compliance culture survey, training completion, Speak Up trend).
2. Investigations
Advise management on DFI’s compliance with regulatory requirement and ethics standards. Also, interpret and communicate DFI’s ethical and compliance standards to the DFI business.
Implement measures and prepare reports that monitor the overall effectiveness of DFI’s compliance and ethics program (e.g. annual compliance culture survey, training completion, Speak Up trend).
Perform investigations on matters of serious concerns when escalated by the business or raised via DFI’s Speak Up channel particularly if ethical in nature (e.g. fraud, bribery).
Draft and communicate to business stakeholders’ investigation results which includes identifying control deficiencies or weaknesses, fraud matters, root causes and aligned action plan.
Validate the aligned actions taken by management following the investigation.
Do you have experience in compliance, ethics and investigations?
Bachelor’s degree in law, business administration or a related field
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a Compliance, Ethics and investigations, preferably in retail industry
Demonstrable experience of delivery of successful compliance, business conduct and ethics programmes in a large and complex organization
Strong knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards
Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) is a strong asset
Experience in audit and risk management is an asset
Excellent verbal, written communication and report writing skills in English and Cantonese
Analytical and problem-solving abilities
Attention to detail and commitment to ethical integrity
Project management and organizational skills

metadata.Name: Senior Group Risk, Compliance and Ethics Manager

title: Assistant Demand & Supply Planning Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Demand and Supply Planning?

The challenge is to: 

  • Lead a team of Planning officers to manage forecasting, daily replenishment and inventory control at DC based on sales trend, promotion schedule and display requirement.
  • Analyze actual product demand, research demand drivers, seasonality, market situation, refine the forecast to reflect updated sales momentum, and adjust inventory plans for normal, festive, seasonal ranges accordingly.
  • Collaborate with Commercial team to ensure sales forecast accuracy and align on new range and promotion forecast.
  • Prepare purchase plan base on aligned forecast, monitor order fulfillment from vendors and follow thru shipment activities of overseas suppliers.
  • Monitor key supplier performance and liaise on demand and supply requirement.
  • Optimize inventory level at warehouse while maintaining high service level; identify root cause and resolve out-of-stock/excess stock situation.
  • Responsible for inventory optimization at different store profile to drive sales and maintain a healthy level of availability at stores
  • Monitor KPI and execute improvement actions as necessary. Prepare regular reports and analysis for management review.
  • Achieve company target and carry out other duties as required by business.

 

Do you have experience in Supply Chain?

  • Bachelors Degree in Supply Chain management or relevant aspect
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in demand and supply planning, preferably from Retail or FMCG industry
  • Sensitive to numbers, strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Self-motivated, well organized and able to work independently
  • Competent to work in a fast-paced and dynamic retail environment
  • Proficient in Excel. Experience in Demand Forecast Tool / Supply planning system is an advantage
  • Fluent in English and Cantonese

title: Assistant Regional Operations Manager
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Retail Operations?

The challenge is to:

  • Lead a team of 3-5 area managers to run 100 Health and Beauty stores in HK and Macau to enhance business opportunities  
  • Work well with internal departments, Marketing, Commercial, and Logistics teams to efficiently implement sales activities, business promotion initiatives and merchandising plans at store level
  • Explore new business opportunities regularly and formulate the store development plan 
  • Implement people development plans and empower team members to drive excellent service and store efficiency

 

Do you have experience in Retail / FMCG industry?

  • Tertiary education or equivalent 
  • 5-8 years of supervisory experience in the retail, beauty, fashion & apparel or related industries. Preferably in the FMCG or health products-related business 
  • Strong experience in retail operations and management 
  • Sensitive to the commercial market 
  • Prioritizes customer needs, mature, able to work independently
  • Good analytical minds, strong leadership and people skills

title: Category Manager (Grocery)
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in category management?

  • To implement the merchandise, buying and pricing strategies for designated categories to increase category penetration, drive sales and margin, enhance competitive edges and capitalize market opportunities.
  • To execute and evaluate merchandising activities and category plans of customers' interests
  • To build and manage relationships with vendors for long term strategic partnership
  • To ensure healthy stock level by good promotion plan and stock management 
  • To source locally or overseas with good understanding of market trend

 

Do you have experience in merchandising?


  • University graduate or tertiary education
  • Minimum 4 years retail merchandising experience
  • Good influencing and negotiation skill
  • Analytical, creative, customer focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated
  • Good interpersonal and people management skill
  • Good communication skill and good command of English and Chinese
  • Knowledge of category management

title: CRM and Partnership Senior Specialist
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Promotion & Partnership?

 

Strategic Partnership Planning & Development:

  • Lead the joint planning and development of comprehensive payment promotion roadmaps and co-marketing initiatives with banking, payment wallet, and financial institution partners to drive mutual business growth and customer acquisition.

End-to-End Project Leadership:

  • Manager entire promotion lifecycle with partners, from strategic ideation and contract negotiation to communication execution, including system integration, offer configuration, compliance alignment, and communication instore and ATL.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Influence:

  • Proactively collaborate with and influence internal teams (Internal Marketing, Operations, Finance, Legal, IT) to align resources, mitigate risks, and ensure seamless execution of joint promotions and partnership projects.

Data-Driven Performance Optimization:

  • Design and implement robust frameworks to evaluate partnership and promotion effectiveness.
  • Analyze performance data to generate strategic insights and actionable recommendations for optimizing ROI and partnership value.

Stakeholder & Relationship Management:

  • Build and maintain strong, strategic relationships with junior-to-senior level contacts at partner organizations (banks, payment wallets, financial institutions). 
  • Act as the primary liaison for all partnership matters and strategic discussions.

Strategic Initiative Leadership:

  • Identify and pursue new partnership opportunities, innovative engagement models, and scalable processes to expand the partnership portfolio and drive long-term revenue growth.

 

Do you have experience in the Retail / FMCG industry?

 

  • Degree in Marketing/ Business Administration/ Communications or related disciplines
  • At least 5 years of partnership experience focusing on payment promotion partnerships with banking/financial institutions/payment wallets
  • Experience in retail, FMCG is an advantage
  • Presentable and strong in communication, stakeholder management
  • A team player, detail-minded, independent, fast learner with good analytical skills
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese
  • High proficiency in MS Office applications and Chinese word processing

title: Business Solutions Lead
description_html:
We seek a data-driven technology leader to serve as the strategic business partner for our Health & Beauty division, combining strategic advisory, solution design, and daily operational stewardship. You’ll bridge technology, digital, and business goals by designing customer-centric solutions, managing high-impact projects, and pioneering innovations that elevate customer propositions. This role demands equal parts strategic advisor, project leader, and internal entrepreneur—all focused-on scaling H&B experiences through technology.  

 

Is this your next challenge in IT Strategic Partnering?

Strategic Business Partnership

·       Partner with Health & Beauty business leaders to co-create technology roadmaps tied to outcomes.

·       Proactively identify gaps in capabilities, data, or processes and design solutions that unlock growth 

·       Translate H&B goals into technical requirements with clear analytics measurement frameworks 

·       Advise executives on tech investments, risks, and opportunities to drive market differentiation.

 

Solution Stewardship 

·       Co-create end-to-end H&B tech solutions with business leaders, digital product managers, and tech COEs

·       Lead vendor selection/RFP with focus on future-proof capabilities

·       Develop business cases for new investments, including cost-benefit analysis and adoption strategies

 

Project & Program Leadership

·       Lead and manage complex tech initiatives from concept to launch using Agile/Scrum leading cross-functional squads 

·       Work with the business format to define success metrics to guide intended outcome and operational efficiency

·       Govern budgets, timelines, and risk mitigation

·       Report progress to executives with clear links to business impact

 

Internal Entrepreneurship

·       Champion innovation: Pilot emerging tech (hyper-personalization), build proofs-of-concept, and scale successes

·       Drive value extraction of tech assets 

·       Foster a culture of innovation via partnerships with educational institutions, startups, and internal incubators

 


Do you have experience as a Business Solutions Lead?

·       10+ years in tech roles with 3+ years in retail, including solution design, project management, business partnership roles

·       Demonstrated experience on leading 3+ large-scale tech transformations with measurable revenue/efficiency gains

·       Technical Mastery in delivering Retail Excellence e.g. ERP, POS, Digital Commerce, and Marketing Technology

·       Track records of launching new tech-driven capabilities 

 

Critical Competencies

·       Business Acumen: Mastery of marketing/sales funnels, P&L levers, and ROI modeling

·       Domain Fluency: Retail, Health & Beauty, Customer Touchpoints 

·       Influence: Ability to align MDs and format CEO on strategy, trade-offs, and investment decisions.

·       Technology: Familiarity with platform management, AI, MACH architecture, integration design, and agile experimentation frameworks.



DFI Retail Group is an equal opportunity employer and responsible for ensuring that all personal information collected from each Candidate presented to DFI Retail Group is used for recruitment purposes only and the personal data will be kept and handled confidentially. We will retain the applications of candidates not selected for a period of no more than 24 months. The data collection process is in accordance with all applicable laws and compliant with the Code of Practice on Human Resource Management.


To find out more about Our Businesses and Our People, please visit our website: https://www.DFIretailgroup.com


Issued by The Dairy Farm Company, Limited

description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Brand Marketing

The challenge is to:

 

  • Understands the brand identity and translates this to perfection in execution at different touch points
  • Support campaign launch from ATL to BTL communications
  • Support the implementation of new branding projects in answering ever-changing retail environment
  • Partner with different collaborators in supporting store opening and improve the customer journey

  • Well-organised, enjoy working in fast-paced organisation
  • Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese

description_html:

工作地點: 葵涌三號貨櫃碼頭


工作時間: 每週工作6天，輪休

早班︰上午7時至下午4時/上午8時至下午5時/上午9時至下午6時 或

title: Dietitian 營養師
description_html:
Is this your next challenge in Health & Beauty Sector?

  • Identify customers needs, and suggest an appropriate nutritional solution to customers
  • Provide professional product advice to customers, to health supplement / vitamin / slimming products
  • Prepare and conduct product training for staff
  • Answer customer enquiries in terms of products (hotline and stores)
  • Conduct health test to customer - fat content, water content, BMI, blood pressure, diet consultation, etc 

 

Do you have experience in retail industry?

  • Postgraduate Diploma (or MSc) in Human Nutrition and Dietetics at Hong Kong University SPACE Institute or its equivalent qualifications
  • Pro-active attitude, out- spoken and friendly
  • Fluent in both spoken Chinese and English
  • With at least 1 year retail experience, preferably in health products

title: Locum Pharmacist 兼職藥劑師
description_html:
The best way to deliver caring customer experience is with our professional pharmacist team. To cope with our continuous growth and expansion, we welcome candidates who are HK registered pharmacist or candidates who are awaiting confirmation of registration certificate from Pharmacy and Poisons Board of Hong Kong. A comprehensive training program is provided to all newly recruited members. Apart from performing Pharmacist role, you will also be the shop-in-charge to monitor the store operations, we are seeking for high caliber professionals for below positions.

Is this your next challenge in Retail Operations?

  • To provide professional health counseling service to our customers
  • To provide information about knowledge of medications
  • To assist Store Manager in monitoring store operations
  • To extend the expertise on pharmacist in community

 

Do you have experience in retail store operations and transformation? 

  • Degree holder in Pharmacy
  • A holder of Pharmacist Certificate of Registration and a valid Annual Practising Certificate issued by the Pharmacy and Poisons Board of Hong Kong.
  • Independent, self-motivated and customer focused
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proficient in English and Chinese

description_html:
通過9個月訓練期，可晉升為分店副經理
